nodes.bodyText: I presume you meant "representation"?
Same typo again?
I believe the terminology decided on was "quality level" not label?
quality level

Sounds strange, suggestion:
"SCM repository where the build's sources are stored."
Mixed terminology: You use build config in other doc strings, here you use build configuration.
"A Build Config contains..."

Spelling mistakes:
mede -> made
alfanumeric -> alphanumeric

Clunky.
Suggestion:
"It defines pre-build operations and sets the proper repository"

This could probably do with a little more explanation:
My suggestion:
"This class is used to maintain an audit trail of modifications made to a Build Config. Each instance represents a specific revision of a build config."

Sounds strange, suggestion:
"SCM repository where the build's sources are stored."
If you agree to the change on the full entity, change also here on the ref.
Is this actually a revision number? Isn't the counter shared by all revisions? If so it could be a bit misleading to call it the revision number of a build config? If i'm wrong ignore this :)
I think it may be shared by all the build configs. But isn't it still a revision number? What would you call it instead?

I interpret "revision number" in the sense that 4 would mean the 4th revision of this build config. That might just be me, I would call it a "revision ID" if it is just a unique identifier for the revision instance in the DB.
If accepting suggested change on full entity, also change here on ref.
A Milestone
Clunky. Suggestion: "The ProductVersion this milestone belongs to"
A Milestone .... the product(...
A Product
"product"
[double or -> use comma] "... assigned to a particular product, product version or product release"
a version of
needs
Is the "Representation of" needed here? IMO every object is a representation of something, so I would drop it.
Again "Representation of".
I would change the first sentence to "A unique identifier of the artifact in a repository."
"qualifier" => "classifier"
This is the path inside the repository, not path to the repository.
We should here that for built artifacts the value is always null.
Also here the value is null for built artifact.
Drop the "representation of " also here please.
